Method Detail

paintSelection

public void paintSelection(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           Scaler scale,
                           int[] ids,
                           ShadeStyle style)
Description copied from interface: Layer
Dispays the specified features. A simple version of paintScaled, this is used to paint a group of features in some way that make it stand out from the other features.
Todate, this has been by using a bright red colour, a more user-definable system maybe implemented in later versions.
Again the only thing that sould call this is a Theme
Overrides:
paintSelection in class SimpleLayer
Following copied from interface: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.Layer
Parameters:
g - A Graphics object to paint the selected features to.
scale - A scaler that can be used to scale the feature.
ids - An int[] for the IDs of the features to be shown as selected.
style - A style with hints on how to display the selection
See Also:
Theme

paintScaled

public void paintScaled(GeoGraphics gg)
Description copied from class: PointLayer
Paints a scaled version of the layer to the given graphics contex.
Generaly only called by a theme that contains this layer.
08/May/2000 - fixed bug#103835 bufferd redraw nologer throws null pointer exception.
Overrides:
paintScaled in class PointLayer
Following copied from class: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.PointLayer
Parameters:
gg - A GeoGraphics containing all of the info needed to paint this layer to screen
